thread.title: UCLA commit LaMelo Ball explodes for 92 points in a high school game
thread.title_full: UCLA commit LaMelo Ball explodes for 92 points in a high school game

author: Matt Ellentuck (matthew.ellentuck@performgroup.com)
title: UCLA commit LaMelo Ball explodes for 92 points in a high school game
text:
February 8, 2017 12:59am EST February 8, 2017 12:49am EST Lonzo Ball's brother might not have called a half-court shot, but coming up eight points shy of 100 is still pretty impressive. UCLA (Paul Nisely/SN IllustrationGetty Images) 
Updated at 12:59 a.m. ET 
Updated at 12:59 a.m. ET 
Chino Hills sophomore high school basketball player and UCLA commit LaMelo Ball, the youngest brother of current UCLA star Lonzo Ball, scored 92 points on Tuesday night in a 146-123 victory, according to the Los Angeles Times . 
He had "just" 29 points at the half, ESPN's Jeff Borzello reported . His other brother and teammate, LiAngelo, did not play due to injury, so LaMelo picked up the slack and then some. 
We're talking about the same kid who called his half-court shot after all. 
You can watch highlights of Ball's insane night, including his 41-point fourth quarter, here: Watch This
